Models¶

Introduction¶

The rate model is a set of coupled, linear differential equations. The model classes contain methods for solving these equations in the steady state using matrix methods. Model2 is the recommended model. See the examples for usage.

API Documentation¶

class spinstats.models.Model2[source]¶

A class for performing calculations of the spin-statistical factor.

states¶

The names of the excited state species.

Type

list of str

rates¶

The names of the different rate constants in the model.

Type

list of str

model_name¶

The name of the model.

Type

str

initial_weighting¶

Dictionary of (str, float) pairs. Key is the state name (str) and value is its initial weight (float).

Type

dict

gaplaw_A¶

Energy gap law prefactor in unts of per ns.

Type

float

gaplaw_gamma¶

Material dependent gamma factor from the energy gap law.

Type

float

gaplaw_Evib¶

Vibrational energy to use in the energy gap law in units of eV.

Type

float

gaplaw_kT¶

Thermal energy for internal conversion calculations in units of eV.

Type

float

G¶

The exciton generation rate for initial_state. Units of per volume per time.

Type

float

kD¶

Rate of triplet-pair dissociation into free triplets. Units of per ns.

Type

float

kTTA¶

(Arbitrary) effective linear rate of triplet-triplet annihilation . UNits of per ns.

Type

float

kIC1¶

Rate of internal conversion from \(^3(TT)\) to \(T_1\). Units of per ns.

Type

float

kIC2¶

Rate of internal conversion from \(^3(TT)\) to \(T_2\). Units of per ns.

Type

float

kIC21¶

Rate of internal conversion from \(T_2\) to \(T_1\). Units of per ns.

Type

float

kRISC¶

Rate of high-level intersystem crossing from \(T_2\) to \(S_1\). Units of per ns.

Type

float

kTF¶

Rate of triplet-pair fusion from weakly exchange-coupled to strongly exchange-coupled. Units of per ns.

Type

float

kTS¶

Rate of triplet-pair separation from strongly exchange-coupled to weakly exchange-coupled. Units of per ns.

Type

float

kSF¶

Rate of singlet fission from \(S_1\) to \(^1(TT)\). Units of per ns.

Type

float

k_SF¶

Rate of triplet-pair fusion from \(^1(TT)\) to :math`S_1`. Units of per ns.

Type

float

kS¶

Radiative rate of the \(S_1\) state. Units of per ns.

Type

float

kT¶

Nonradiative rate of the \(T_1\) state. Should be set to zero for true calculations of spin statistics. Units of per ns.

Type

float

cs¶

1D array containing the overlap factors between the 9 \((T..T)\) states and \(^1(TT)\).

Type

numpy.ndarray

ct_m¶

1D array containing the overlap factors between the 9 \((T..T)\) states and \(^3(TT)_m\), where m is x, y or z.

Type

numpy.ndarray

cq_m¶

1D array containing the overlap factors between the 9 \((T..T)\) states and \(^5(TT)_m\), where m is a, b, x, y or z.

Type

numpy.ndarray

simulation_results¶

Produced by simulate(). Keys are the excited-state names (str), values are the simulated populations (float).

Type

dict

plqy¶

Calculated photoluminescence quantum yield from calculate_plqy().

Type

float

ucqy¶

Calculated upconversion quantum yield from calculate_ucqy().

Type

float

eta¶

Calculated spin-statistical factor from calculate_eta().

Type

float

calculate_eta()[source]¶

Calculate the spin-statistical factor.

Returns

Return type

None.

calculate_internal_conversion_rate(deltaE)¶

Compute an internal conversion rate based on the energy gap law.

Parameters

deltaE (float) – Energy gap between the initial and final state. Positive if the final state is higher in energy.

Returns

kIC – Internal conversion rate in unts of per ns.

Return type

float

calculate_plqy()[source]¶

Calculate the photoluminescence quantum yield.

Returns

Return type

None.

calculate_ucqy()[source]¶

Calculate the upconversion quantum yield.

Returns

Return type

None.

set_spinhamiltonian_parameters(spinhamiltonian)¶

Import calculated overlaps from the spin Hamiltonian

Parameters

spinhamiltonian (spinstats.SpinHamiltonian) – Instance of spinstats.SpinHamiltonian, with parameters already computed.

Returns

Return type

None.

simulate()[source]¶

Calculate the excited state populations.

Returns

Return type

None.
